title: Oiltown USA 1953 christian movie
description:
"Oiltown U.S.A." is interesting as a very early Christian film, the first of many films featuring Billy Graham.



Quote:
Les Manning (Paul Power, Perry Mason, Highway Patrol) is a self-made Texas oilman living in a world of wealth and power. He is used to getting what he wants when he wants it. However, when his only daughter (Colleen Evans, The Walls of Jericho, When Willie Comes Marching Home) begins to discover his sordid lifestyle, and a humble but straight-talking rancher (Redd Harper, Mr. Texas, The Strawberry Roan) stands up to him, Manning's world fractures. Having run from God all his life, Manning must finally come to grips with who he is and his need for change. Special appearance by Billy Graham. Music by legendary Christian composer Ralph Carmichael. Directed by Dick Ross. 1954. Dove Family Approved for All Ages.

Cast: Colleen Townsend, Paul Power, Redd Harper, Cindy Walker, Georgia Lee, Robert Clark. Special appearance by Billy Graham.
